node.title: Daughter sentenced to 23 years for suffocating mother with a pillow
node.alt: Portrait of Veronica Corstorphine, who was allegedly murdered in Launceston
node.description: A West Australian woman who smothered her 71-year-old mother with a pillow in Tasmania and used herÂ credit card to pay for a flight back home is sentenced to 23 years in prison.
node.content:
["Natalie Maher has been sentenced to 23 years jail for suffocating her mother Veronica Corstorphine in Tasmania two years ago.", "Prosecutors in the trial in the Launceston Supreme Court had alleged 48-year-old Maher smothered her 71-year-old mother with a pillow\u00a0when they were living together in Keane Street West in South Launceston in October 3, 2019.", "The court heard Maher left the state two days later and flew back to Western Australia, where she had lived most of her life.", "It was not until late October \u2014\u00a0several weeks after the murder \u2014\u00a0that police found Ms Corstorphine's heavily decomposed body in her bed in the South Launceston home.", "Police body camera vision, which was shown to the jury, showed the moment the body was found. A\u00a0pillow was covering Ms Corstorphine's face and her hands were up beside her head.", "The court also heard Ms Corstorphine's phone was found with Maher in Western Australia when she was arrested\u00a0and that she could not explain why the phone was in her possession.", "Today, after a total of six and a half hours deliberation, the jury returned a unanimous verdict of guilty.", "Maher's\u00a0sentence has been backdated to November 7, 2019 when she was taken into custody.", "She won't be eligible for parole until serving at least 13 years.", "
Relationship had 'fallen apart'
", "Throughout the four-week trial, jurors heard that the mother and daughter's relationship had soured since they started living together in August 2019.", "While giving evidence, Maher told the court it was her mother's idea for her to move to Tasmania.", "\"My partner and I had split,\" Maher told jurors.", "\"There had been an event when I ended up injured and he ended up going to jail and I didn't know how I was going to pay rent.\"", "Maher said her mother arranged for her to come live with her in Tasmania \"and start again\".", "The court heard they started arguing regularly over money and because Maher had not \"found a job quick enough\".", "Both the mother and daughter drank heavily and Ms Corstorphine was known as a \"chain smoker\", the court heard.", "Prosecutor John Ransom said on October 2 \u2014\u00a0the day before the alleged murder \u2014\u00a0the pair had got into a verbal argument while another friend was around for dinner.", "Mr Ransom said the fact their relationship had \"fallen apart\" was motive for murder.", "\"The accused is bigger [than Ms Corstorphine]\u00a0\u2026 she put the pillow over her mother's head \u2026 her mother has struggled and she's lost.\"", "Jurors heard that on the night of the alleged murder, Ms Corstorphine's credit card was used to book one-way airline tickets for Maher back to Western Australia.", "The court was also told that between October 3 and 4\u00a0all the money in Ms Corstorphine's bank account was transferred to her daughter's.", "", "
The Launceston Supreme Court\u00a0heard Ms Maher's DNA was found on the edge of the cushion but it was never tested for saliva or other bodily fluids.(Flickr: Jonathan Ah Kit)
", "Prosecutors claimed Maher purchased the airline tickets and transferred the money.", "However, the defence argued Ms Corstorphine had booked the airline tickets for Maher so she could return to Western Australia for her own daughter's school graduation.", "Defence lawyer Evan Hughes said it was also not uncommon for Ms Corstorphine to transfer money to her daughter and that her superannuation payment was due to go into her account within days.", "The defence had also claimed Maher did not know her mother was dead until she was back in Western Australia.\u00a0", "
Cushion murder weapon too small, defence argued
", "In his closing address, Mr Hughes argued the pillow \u2014\u00a0which he showed to the court and described as a cushion \u2014\u00a0was too small to be used as a murder weapon.", "The pillow was a square shape decorative throw cushion.\u00a0", "\"Look at its size,\" Mr Hughes told jurors. \"Think about the size of a human head.", "The court heard while Maher's DNA was found on the edge of the cushion, it was never forensically tested for saliva or other bodily fluids.", "The defence argued it was more likely that the throw cushion had fallen onto Ms Corstorphine head after she'd taken her own life or died of natural causes, like a stroke.", "The court heard there was no analysis of the deceased's stomach content and that prescription medication in her house could have been used by the deceased to commit suicide."]
